data.title: Famous People Born in December 1911
data.meta_description: Celebrate the birthdays of 45 famous people, historical figures and celebrities born in December 1911 like Klaus Fuchs, Broderick Crawford and Walter Alston.
data.text:
Calvin Griffith, Canadian baseball team owner (Washington Senators/Minnesota Twins 1955-84), born in Montreal, Quebec (d. 1999)

Dec 1 Franz Binder, Austrian soccer striker and manager (19 caps Austria, 9 caps Germany; Rapid Vienna), born in St. Pölten, Austria (d. 1989)

Walter Alston

American Baseball Hall of Fame manager (World Series 1955, 59, 63, 65; Brooklyn/Los Angeles Dodgers), born in Venice, Ohio

Nino Rota [Giovanni Rota Rinaldi], Italian classical and film score composer (Il cappello di paglia di Firenze; The Godfather (I & II); 16 Federico Fellini films), born in Milan, Italy (d. 1979)

Alfred Manessier, French painter (leaded windows), born in Saint-Ouen, Somme, France (d. 1993)

Dec 5 Władysław Szpilman, Polish pianist and classical composer, born in Sosnowiec, Congress Poland, Russian Empire (d. 2000)

Alfred James Broomhall, British Protestant Christian medical missionary to China, born in Shandong, China (d. 1994)

Lee J. Cobb [Leo Jacoby], American actor (Virginian, 12 Angry Men, On the Waterfront), born in New York City (d. 1976)

Dec 8 Nikos Gatsos, Greek poet and lyricist, born in Asea, Greece (d. 1992)

Broderick Crawford

American actor (All the King's Men, Highway Patrol), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Ryūzō Sejima, Japanese army officer and educator, born in Toyama, Japan (d. 2007)

Chet Huntley, American newscaster (NBC Huntley-Brinkley Report), born in Cardwell, Montana (d. 1974)

Naguib Mahfouz, Egyptian novelist (Palace Walk, Sugar Street) and first Arabic writer to win a Nobel Prize (1988), born in Cairo, Egypt (d. 2006)

Buzz Borries, American College Football Hall of Fame halfback (Navy 1932–34), born in Louisville, Kentucky (d. 1969)

Kenneth Patchen

American poet and novelist (Cloth of the Tempest), born in Niles, Ohio

Dec 13 Trygve Haavelmo, Norwegian economist and 1989 Nobel laureate for his contributions to econometrics, born in Skedsmo, Norway (d. 1999)

Hans von Ohain, German-American aerospace engineer, developed 1st turbojet engine, born in Dessau, Duchy of Anhalt German Empire (d. 1998) [1]

Dec 14 Ota Adler, Czech-British fur trader and founder (Federal Trust), born in Kraslice, Czechoslovakia (d. 1995)

Dec 14 Spike Jones [Lindley Armstrong Jones], American bandleader (Der Fueher's Face, Cocktails For Two), born in Long Beach, California (d. 1965)

Nicholas P. Dallis, American psychiatrist and comic strip writer (Rex Morgan, M.D.), born in New York City (d. 1991)

Dec 15 Stan Kenton, American musician, jazz pianist, arranger and bandleader (Artistry In Rhythm), born in Wichita, Kansas (d. 1979)

William Roerick, American actor (The Wasp Woman, Guiding Light), born in Hoboken, New Jersey (d. 1995)

Helen Vlachos, Greek newspaper publisher (closed her newspapers in protest at military junta), born in Athens, Greece (d. 1995)

Dec 18 Jules Dassin, American film director (The Naked City; Night And The City; Rififi), blacklisted during McCarthy era, born in Middletown, Connecticut (d. 2008)

Dec 18 Peg Leg Sam [Arthur Jackson], American country blues harmonica player, singer and comedian, born in Jonesville, South Carolina (d. 1977)

Hortense Calisher, American novelist (President of the American Academy of Arts and Letters), born in New York City (d. 2009)

Josh Gibson

American Baseball HOF catcher (Negro World Series 1943, 44; 12 × NL All-Star; Triple Crown 1936, 37; batting average .466 1943), born in Buena Vista, Georgia

Paul Burkhard, Swiss composer, born in Zürich, Switzerland (d. 1977)

Grote Reber, American radio astronomer (1st parabolic radio telescope), born in Wheaton, Illinois (d. 2002)

James Gregory, American actor (My Favorite Martian, Barney Miller), born in The Bronx, New York (d. 2002)

Dec 23 Niels Jerne, Danish immunologist (1984 Nobel Prize for Medicine or Physiology), born in London, England (d. 1994)

Eric Briault, British educationalist (d. 1996)

Dec 24 Malcolm MacEwen, Scottish conservationist & communist activist, born in Inverness, Scotland (d. 1996)

Burne Hogarth, American strip-cartoon artist (Tarzan), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 1996)

Dec 25 Louise Bourgeois, French American artist (Femme Maison), born in Paris, France (d. 2010)

Renato Guttuso, Italian painter (Flight From Etna; Crucifixion), theater set designer, and politician, born in Bagheria, Sicily, Italy (d. 1987)

Dec 26 Steve Kordek, American pinball machine designer, born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 2012)

Anna Russell, English music satirist and composer, born in London, England (d. 2006)

Dec 27 Endre Szervánszky, Hungarian composer (Dark Heaven Requiem), born in Budatétény, Budapest, Hungary (d. 1977)

Phani Majumdar, Indian filmmaker (Street Singer), born in Faridpur Sadar Upazila, British India (d. 1994)

Dec 28 Sam Levenson, American humorist (Sam Levenson Show, Masquerade Party), born in New York City (d. 1980)

(Robert) "Cutty" Cutshall, American jazz trombonist (Benny Goodman Orchestra; Eddie Condon), born in Huntington County, Pennsylvania (d. 1968)

Klaus Fuchs

German-British atomic physicist and spy for the Soviet Union, born in Rüsselsheim, German Empire

Jeanette Nolan, American actress (Richard Boone Show, Virginian), born in Los Angeles, California (d. 1998)

Dal Stivens, Australian novelist, born in Blayney, Australia (d. 1997)

About December 1911

How Old? 112 years old

Generation: Greatest Generation

Leap Year: No

Chinese Zodiac: Pig

Star Signs: Sagittarius (Nov 22 - Dec 21), Capricorn (Dec 22 - Jan 19)
